Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Clint F
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on par with most Hampton Inns: Hot breakfast, friendly staff, clean rooms, convenient business center, clean pool and fitness center. The location of the hotel is conveniently located for access to the hot spots in Branson but, not right in the middle of the congestion. I would definitely stay here again especially considering other options in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: hawaiiluver
Reviews.Content: This is really in a great area! New shopping malls, with Target, TJ Maxx and others. The Rec Center is less than a 1/2 mile. This is off the strip, but only 7 - 10 away from anything you want to do (depending on the traffic). This appears to be a new hotel, is very clean with friendly and very helpful staff. From the moment we checked in to a small issue I was treated like an old friend! My TV channels were sporadic. I called the front desk (Alex maybe) and in less than 5 minutes I was in another room. I would highly recommend this hotel, quiet but very close to all the action!

Reviews.Title: “People”
Reviews.Author: Doug H
Reviews.Content: After the physical cleanliness and amenities I always find the People make the experience. Miss Judy and the rest of the front desk staff was outstanding. I had 8 rooms booked fro a golf outing and she (they) made each of us feel like a priority. They volunteered to make a dinner reservation for us (not easy for 15 guys) and made sure all our needs were met.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and extremely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CarleyM13
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hampton Inn - Branson Hills for a business trip. After my last experience with a Hampton Inn, I was a little hesitant to book the room, but honestly this hotel was one of the better options when it comes to Branson hotels. Hotel/Room - I believe the hotel is on the newer side. The entire place was extremely clean! That's a huge plus for me. My room was spotless, along with my bed linens, which made me very happy. Staff - Judy up at the front desk could not have been any nicer when I was checking in. She also assisted me in book their conference room. She is extremely sweet and kind and immediately made me feel at home. Location - The actual location of the hotel is an exit away from the main strip in Branson, as well as Branson Landing. I loved the location, as you don't have to deal with the traffic on the main strip every time you leave the hotel. I loved my stay at the Hampton Inn - Branson Hills and will be returning to the hotel on my next trip out there. I highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a clean hotel, at a good rate, with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: wps24
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights one weekend. Although the hotel was full, it was quiet. The room was very clean and the beds comfortable. We liked the location, which is out of the way a bit, but we like being away from the strip in Branson. The staff was friendly & helpful. We plan to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelerTX_8
Reviews.Content: Bill, at the front desk was very helpful and made adjustments in our room to make it comfortable for us. We had inadvertently booked through Expedia.com and our specific needs had not been forwarded to the hotel. Bill managed to get us into a handicap accessible room and brought in a roll-a-way to make the room work for us. He was also very knowledgeable and gave us some great tips on navigating the area and finding great shops and sandwich shops.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Views and Perfect Locations”
Reviews.Author: NAC_rainbowbrite
Reviews.Content: Upon checkin the gentleman at the desk was super helpful and when I asked if we could get a room with a view for my husbands first time in Branson he easily moved us around to accomodate that request. When first booking the room I actually wanted to stay closer to the HWY 76 strip, but when leaving my husband and I both agreed this location was perfect!!! It had restaurants, walmart, and several shops that are specific to the location close by without having to be stuck in the traffic with tourists. We do have some complaints though. The beds were rock hard. Now I like hard beds, but these were even hard for me. The pillows were super flat. So bring your pillows from home. (I know I will.) And on the fourth floor even though you walk in the middle of the hall, you can hear creaking all throughout the walls. (Don't know if this might have been some residual damage caused by the tornado that went through a couple months before.) When I originally booked the room I requested a tub, but I guess when I asked if we could have a room with a view he forgot about the tub so we got a room with a shower. All of these I can live with especially with the deal we were getting for our stay, but when we first went into our room my husband used the restroom and the toliet was filthy!!! That's really bad for me...it was almost like maybe the maintnance person had used the restroom in an emergency and the housekeeping staff hadn't entered the room since. When we left for dinner I told the gentleman at the desk about it and requested special housekeeping and all I got was Oh gosh...and we'll have someone with you tomorrow. It was a little off putting, but we lived with it. I would have rather had an "I'm sorry" and then an explanation of I don't have anyone else working with me tonight can we take care of it in the morning? That I would understand. I did pretty much enjoyed our stay here. The breakfasts were very good. Staff very friendly. Locations was fantastic!!! All-in-all we will definately be coming back. In fact a group of girlfriends and I are considering Branson for another trip and if we do...this is where we'll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality & comfort”
Reviews.Author: Karena D
Reviews.Content: When in Branson recently, we decided last minute to spend the night on a very crowded weekend. The hotel staff (Judy) checked their other Hamptons for vacancies. When she found none, she offered to call me if they had a cancellation. She did just that! That evening we were greated by friendly, welcoming staff (Matt at the front desk especially) & a clean comfortable room. The next morning a new set of staff were just as welcoming & helpful - they made us feel like we were importnt to them!! Thanks Hampton - you did it again!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: AlGill
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times ever since it opened a few years ago and have always had a wonderful experience. It is situated on a hill surrounded by a golf course and is in a perfect location to drive via the back roads to almost every theatre and restaurant in town. There is no traffic near the Inn and it is quiet and peacful, a welcome place to return to each day. The staff, especially teh Manager Judy and Alex at the front desk, go out of their way to make sure that your stay is as enjoyable as possible. This is the only place we will stay when we do return to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean, first rate!”
Reviews.Author: Tony G
Reviews.Content: Thank you to Judy at the front desk, and everyone at this Hampton Inn location! They did everything to be sure our stay was top notch! Your location is close to the strip, or downtown, or any side of Table Rock Lake without all the traffic!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Shelly C
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with this hotel. Not only were the accomodations perfect for our vacation but the location was as well. Being a new visitor to Branson, we were unsure of the location of the theaters and what shows we really wanted to see. After speaking with the morning and evening front desk staff, we were able to set our entire agenda for the week and definitely feel like we saw every part of Branson that we wanted to experience. The staff was quiet in the mornings while cleaning and always greeted us whenever we would come or go. It really felt like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Is this the new Hampton Inn prototype?”
Reviews.Author: getpoints12
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean but the rooms are very small. They do not include a microwave or refrigerator, however, you can get one if you ask. (Not a lot of space for these items in the room.) It was no problem for us, but there is no bathtub - only a shower stall. The breakfast was very good and the area very clean. It's a good, quiet location in Branson because it is away from the strip, yet there is easy access to the strip. The hotel is OK but it did not meet the standard of Hampton Inn hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: DebbieKTustin
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank staff at this hotel to help us when we encountered a difficult incident during our vacation in Missouri. I slipped and fell during our vacation and broke my knee cap. My husband took me to an ER and I was given crutches and a removable cast. We booked this hotel at our last night in Branson before we catched a flight back to California. I didn't want to stay in other hotel because I am familiar with the brand and a member of Hilton Honors. I also needed the Business Center so I can call the airline for wheel chair transfers and to call my doctors in California. I know that Hilton hotels have a Business Center and felt comfortable that I will be taken care of by the concierge or front desk. True enough, I asked for a handicap room on the first floor when I called to book it since I needed the bench seat for my shower. At first, there was no handicap room available. I asked for anything that is on the first floor and was booked into a King size room with a shower. However, when we checked in we were told that a handicap room was available so we were switched to this room. The front desk staff, a guy, was very helpful and quick. We were mighty glad and it turned out that the room was across from the Business Center. I used the Business Center and the guy in the front desk was very nice to help me connecting to my airline. He was very patience although I was not in a good mood and in pain. I was able to use the internet connection, phone to call for doctors appointment, and sent emails. It was very helpful. The room was exquisite for what I needed. It was large and very clean. The bed was so comfortable also. I slept well despite my condition. It was very quiet all night long. The shower was large and was so easy to use for someone in crutches. There was a HD TV in the room and a davenport. It was very comfortable room. This was what I needed at that time, comforts. The breakfast was also good and just right across, very near our room. They have hot and cold breakfast. I was not in the mood to have a large breakfast but I saw that it was well stocked. My husband enjoyed the breakfast. We were so slow in moving and packing that morning and was reaching the time for checkout. Although we have about 1 hour before we needed to go to the airport, we weren't ready and were slow due to my condition. I called the front desk and the staff gave us an extension to checkout from the room. She was very helpful and symphatetic. It was not easy to travel with a broken knee but the staff and accommodation of this hotel made it easier for me to go through it. The comforts that this hotel provided was priceless. Again, I would like to thank everyone in this hotel whom made us comfortable. I didn't catch anyone's name since I was not myself at that time and had a lot in my mind.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room!”
Reviews.Author: rdavidc
Reviews.Content: Newer hotel in Branson... Room wasn't ready when I arrived at 2:30;

Reviews.Title: “Such a Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: whipporwillgranny
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the cleanest and friendliest that i have ever stayed in. The rooms, beds, towels, and bath were all spotless. The breakfast was hot and filled with variety. All kinds of juices, fresh fruit, waffles, biscuits and gravy, omelet. (on Sunday) and rolls and cereals. The staff was very pleasant, exceptional in my estimation. Also, even though we had a discounted rate due to family ties, we were treated with the utmost respect.Thank you for a lovely stay.Oh yes, even though we were quite away from the "strip", we found this to be a plus. We could get right on and off the roads and by-passes and there were eating places very close by and shopping if you desiredl

Reviews.Title: “A New Hotel with an Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: sleepingdogsfla
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The hotel looks new and the front desk staff was excellent. They helped us choose just the right restaurant to celebrate our anniversary to include making reservations and gave us a coupon for a free desert. Definitely a better choose than staying down town.

Reviews.Title: “New...but not ready for guests!”
Reviews.Author: Mark43
Reviews.Content: This property is in a very new area of Branson. It is definitely off of the main strip, and can be hard to find...off of Branson Hills Parkway, between Highways 465 and 248. I don't know what was going on the day we 'tried' to check in, but Bill (the nice reception guy) apologized and said that something was wrong with housekeeping and the room was not ready. I looked around, and the reception area was filled with other people waiting for their room to check in. Bill took my cell phone number and offered to call me when the room was ready. I overheard one group saying that they had been waiting 1.5 hours. I didn't have that long to wait, and left to go to the show. I did get a call from Bill, 50 minutes later saying the room was ready. The room ended up being a handicap room. The amenities in the room were all nice, but I noticed that the caulk in the shower was already cracked. The shower curtain was not designed for a handicap shower, so water went everywhere on the floor. Whereas a Bill was trying to be helpful., I observed another 'management type' person just walking around. I would have expected (with a room full of unhappy, waiting guest) that someone might have rolled up their sleeves and gone to try and resolve the housekeeping problem. At checkout the desk clerk didn't even ask if I had enjoyed my stay, or apologized for the delay getting into my room. Oh yeah, they don't have any of those luggage ramps on the sidewalk -and- there are no sheer curtains. The curtains are ether open or closed. We won't go to this property again. It is too far out of the road and we didn't get the impression that they appreciated our business.

Reviews.Title: “This rating should have been a five - Unfortunately housekeeping was terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Blooms65
Reviews.Content: We always stay at Hampton Inns and have never had a bad experience. We selected this one because we didn't want to be right on the strip and hubby wanted to play golf at the Payne Stewart Course next door. The staff that we dealt with (Bill and Judy) were the best, great people and very accommodating. The breakfast was better than most inns offer and there was a large selection of items to choose from. Parking was always available, even late at night after coming from a show. We got a friendly greeting coming and going and the lobby and breakfast area were very nicely appointed and kept clean. Our room had everything we needed with a nice view of the Branson countryside. We were on the third floor facing the hills. We both found the bed too firm to our liking but mattresses can be subjective. Here's where this Hampton Inn failed badly. Aside from emptying trash cans, cleaning the sink daily and replacing the used towels we had placed on the floor, nothing else was done and I mean nothing. We were there six nights and our bed was never changed and it looked as though a small child had made it if at all. The pillows weren't fluffed and placed properly on the bed and we had pushed the heavy comforter back over the bed end stool where it stayed all week. The mirror was never cleaned, the floor in the bathroom had spots that we think we there when we checked in, the carpeting was never vacuumed; there was still glitter (from a show) around the room every evening. Coffee grounds were left in the coffee pot and cups were not replaced (we had to request them) and we had to also request more lotion. My biggest pet peeve, the toilet paper was not replaced after we had used the last sheet....absolutely unforgivable! We did tell the staff on the forth night and also the cleaning lady in the hall but things didn't improve. We were assured when we checked out that things would change if we decided to ever return. Hopefully they will hire better housekeepers as the one we had was substandard.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with just 1 issue...”
Reviews.Author: Travelingvegan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Branson Hills a couple of weekends ago. We generally stick with the Hilton chain as they tend to be consistently good overall. This hotel was in a nice location, not too close, but not too far from attractions. Breakfast was good: bagels, english muffins, cereal, pastries, fruit, etc. Our room was nice: a good size, modern furniture, and seemed clean until we pulled the covers back for bed. There were MANY small black hairs covering our sheets. Upon further inspection, it seemed that the bed sheets had not been changed. Besides the black hairs, they were wrinkled and smelled. We brought this to the front desk's attention and they provided us with new sheets and assured us this would be reported. Other than this issue, our stay was very nice. The staff was excellent, accommodating, and very friendly. They allow pets here without a pet fee, which was WONDERFUL. We would stay here again, but would inspect the sheets before lying in them!

Reviews.Title: “Hampton on Hill A Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Kimalita
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Branson Hills a few weeks ago and had a VERY good stay. Our room was clean and the hotel staff very eager to please. They were a bit short handed in the housekeeping department, but still provided good service. I love the location because it is not on the "strip" in the heavy traffic. It is also right next door to the new Payne Stewart Golf Course for all you golfers out there! The breakfast every morning was just right, with a good variety.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Caressem
Reviews.Content: I was so disappointed it was nothing I was expecting our room had not been clean our sons bed seemed like pee I asked for a microwave and they didn't have any I had a better stay at the Baymont inn! The beds were hard I could go on and on!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Away from Strip”
Reviews.Author: ppett77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Hampton Inn at Branson Hills. It is a fairly new facility. It was very clean, and the staff was wonderful. We really liked not staying right on the strip with all of the noise and traffic, and the hotel was less than a 10 minute drive from everywhere we wanted to go. Very Pleased.

Reviews.Title: “We usually always stay at Hampton Inn's - not this time!”
Reviews.Author: chrisj j
Reviews.Content: Below is a copy of an email we sent to corporate via their website... We were scheduled to stay for 3 days at this hotel, but due to the condition of the hotel rooms, we left within 30 minutes of arrival and found accommodations elsewhere. After checking in, we went to our room and as we began settling in and opened the blinds, we became aware that the conditions of the room were not up to par for a Hampton Inn. To name a few, there were black marks on the wall by the door, a squashed bug on the wall by the window, smear/smudge marks on the flat screen tv, smear/smudge marks on the desk top (as if it was either unclean, or cleaned improperly)...but the thing that put us over the edge was the bathroom, where on the back of the door our 10 year old son brought to our attention what appeared to be a dried smear of blood approximately 8 inches long. I immediately spoke with the staff at the front desk and informed them of the condition of the room. They put us in another room down the hall that we found to be equally disgusting. The same smear/smudge marks were on the furniture and tv, and there were dirt smudges on the bathroom light switch. I immediately returned to the desk and informed them that we would not be staying in the hotel and they cancelled the reservation. While the staff were apologetic, there was no way we were going to tolerate the subpar conditions of the rooms, in what appeared to be a relatively new hotel. Given that Hampton Inns are normally a top choice for us in our family travels, and how this experience tainted our view of this corporate chain of hotels, I felt compelled to send this letter in hope that this gets brought to the attention of someone who may be able to affect a positive change. - to date we have not received any response.

Reviews.Title: “Great place.”
Reviews.Author: Katrina1415
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed one night. Room was very clean. The bed wasn't the most comfortable, but far from the worst I've ever slept on. I liked that this hotel was away from the bumper to bumper traffic on highway 76. It's in a newly developed section of Branson. Which I found appealing, but others may not. The complimentary breakfast had a good variety of selections. I did not use the fitness room or pool, but both looked clean and cared for. I go to Branson at least once or twice a year, and would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: TomA15
Reviews.Content: Though this hotel is not on the strip, it is only minutes away from downtown and the strip. Everything is new and clean plus the staff was very helpful in everyway. We plan to stay here on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “100% Customer Satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: asiapointriders
Reviews.Content: I actually had a reservation an hour down the road, but the weather was stormy and I was tired, and the nice lady at the Branson Airport called and confirmed there were "plenty of non-smoking Kings." I was onsite within 20 mins but there were no non-smoking Kings available! It was just me, and I could have taken the two queens, but I had already got myself excited about a whole big bed to myself with no kids or pets or piles of laundry to get in my way! I protested that I had been informed I'd have a king and I was truly sad, but the manager on duty assured me that 100% customer satisfaction was the goal. He would upgrade me to a suite (I use the term loosely, it is really the same room but has a sofa bed) and so I got my King after all. The property was clean, I didn't use the workout room or pool but they looked nice. Two small complaints: most Hampton Inns where I have stayed have a complimentary fridge and microwave; this had neither. Most have a large screen tv, and this one was so small I couldn't see the channels from the bed. WiFi was easy access, high speed and no problems. Breakfast was pretty good. There was only one toaster with two slots which created quite a line, but otherwise there was scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, sausage gravy, fresh fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, pastries, bagels/english muffins, and a waffle maker. The location is great -- close to the RecPlex and Walmart, Kohls, Best Buy, TJ Maxx, homeDepot, Target.... Nearby restaurants include Chillis, McDonalds, Freddy's and a Pizza Hut. Luigi's delivers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but...”
Reviews.Author: AQD
Reviews.Content: Great new property. Nice indoor pool. Nice view from 4th floor, but not in walking distance for amenities. Must request fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great access away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: MikeM49
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times in the past year, mostly on business. It is a typical Hampton, which means that it has all of the amenities for business travelers, like a well-equipped workout room, wi-fi, sufficient work space in the rooms, and an above average breakfast. As with all Hilton properties, it is 100% non-smoking. I like the location, because it has easy access to Hwy 65, but it is far enough away from the strip (Hwy 76) to avoid traffic jams, and yet I can get to either the Landing or the strip in about ten minutes.

Reviews.Title: “just what we were looking for!! clean, easy, and new!”
Reviews.Author: arkansashogs
Reviews.Content: great little hotel OFF the main strip!! our first time to branson so we didnt know what to expect and I was so very thankful not to stay on the ridiculously crowded/traffic crazed main strip. The hotel was a short 5-8 min drive to all the main restaurants in town, about 10 min to white water, and about 15-20min from silver dollar city. what more could you ask for? Bill made us fresh cookies every evening at the hotel as we were on our way out for the evening. Since the hotel is only 2 years old, it was very "fresh" feeling. Breakfast was good, they had waffles, toast, fruit, coffee, hard boiled eggs, and a hot item every morning. Housekeeping did not wake us up, and we slept in until 9:30 or so every morning, but our room was spotless by the time we got back in the afternoons! There is a Chili's just down the road for a quick bite. Would stay here again for sure for my next trip to Branson. Tips: Go to Noah The Musical! It was wonderful. Take shoes/flip flops to silver dollar city in the summer, the concrete is HOT! Try the "Wasabi" sushi place on the main strip..... yummy and great service!

Reviews.Title: “Large spacious room for ball players!”
Reviews.Author: cheapmomofthree
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night, but it was a great nights sleep. The room was much larger then the hotel we had stayed in nights prior. Bathroom was nice and large as well. The nights before, at another hotel, I had a very hard time sleeping because the a/c kept going on and off all night to keep the room cool. But not here, I did not hear the a/c at all and slept well. They offered free breakfast, the usual fare. The best part is you were off the congested strip, but just minutes from everything. I was there to watch my daughter play softball, so it was very close to the rec plex. So a great location for those coming to Branson to play ball. We will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: ilov2travel
Reviews.Content: our hotel stay was nice. The room was generally clean and morning breakfasts were good. Staff was very friently and helpful. The only complaint I have is that the common areas are not kept clean - spills on the floor and elevator and never cleaned up. The room was clean but can tell they are doing less - its fine that the linens aren't changed every day but the floor could have been vacuumed. Overall a good stay and we'd stay here again. Location is great off the strip and close to 65.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Janet79720
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the beginning of June and was one of a large group that was staying there. The check in process was fast. Unlike the reviewed below, our room was clean, the hallways and elevators looked clean. The breakfast had a great variety. I will definately stay there again if I came back that way.

Reviews.Title: “From "new and upscale" to "worn and dirty" in just over a year's time”
Reviews.Author: pibi63040
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here twice before -- in November 2009 and Feb 2010 -- we were pleased to find an attractive rate on Easter weekend -- $10 less than the Hampton on The Strip. Severe storms had knocked out the phone and computer systems, but the manager and staff introduced themselves, explained the situation, checked us in, led us to our rooms and issued keys in quick time. Despite the confusion, we couldn't help but notice that the elevator doors were dirty: not just fingerprints, but hadn't-been-cleaned-in-a-long-time dirty -- inside and out. The hall carpets were really worn and dirty, with accumulated dust in the corners. We were given a room (#425) on the top floor, and upon entering, immediately remembered what had impressed us about this Hampton Inn: spacious room, with "little extras" beyond what you often receive in a Hampton: mini fridge, large desk and comfy chair, easy chair, and expanded bath amenities. BUT we also immediately noticed what looked to be either excessive wear or excessive dirt on the carpet. So we started to check the room out and we found the previous guest's food still in the fridge. Easily overlooked, I told myself, so my son simply called the front desk to let them know. We found the bathroom to be clean, though the finish on the wood vanity was quite worn through and not touched up or restained. At breakfast, we were pleased to find sausage patties and french toast sticks, which my kids enjoy much more than the eggs and "breakfast pizzas" served at most hamptons. While packing up, we discovered a pervious guest's dirty sock under the bed. This combined with the leftover food and dirty carpets in our room and dirty corridors and elevators left us feeling disappointed in just how far a property can decline in just over a year's time. I hope they will clean it up because we really enjoyed the out -of-the-way location and the spacious accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: akrsouth
Reviews.Content: We came in very late and the staff was great getting us in and our Semi parked. While I won't bring a truck there again I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in an upcoming (developing) location”
Reviews.Author: AKAPearl
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two children stayed at this property during New Year's Eve. It is located one (or two) exits past "The Strip", so it was approximately less than two minutes to the shows, etc. The hotel is relatively new. I believe I read that it opened April 2009, and it still has the 'new" feel. The bathrooms have ceramic tile, and granite countertops. The rooms are spacious enough for four people, but I think that would be the limit for a number of days. The heated indoor pool was a sizable area, and the fitness center has a variety of equipment. The hot breakfast was included in the cost- oatmeal, boiled eggs, toast, bagels, cereal, homemade waffles, etc. A different hot item was featured every morning. Check in/check out was a breeze. The location of the property was ideal for me, and it made our visit to Branson even better. Because the property is not located on the strip, it is in a newer developing area. It is directly adjacent to a beautiful golf course. There is a new Wal-Mart, Target, Books-A- Million, Chili's, TJ Maxx, Michaels right down the street. If you are looking for an affordable, MODERN property that is not worn down and it not right in the middle of the "action" this is your spot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetovacation97
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the stay. We were aloud to check in 2hrs early. The kids enjoyed the indoor pool. Rooms cleaned however the carpet in the halls needed vacumed. Our toilet was running for a long time but as soon as we said something they fixed it quickly. Great customer service. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: jodajoda1
Reviews.Content: Its a couple miles off the strip, but that is exactly what we were looking for! Nice and quiet! Room was beautiful, quiet and very comfortable!! The breakfast was super yummy! Great coffee too! I just can't think of one bad thing to say. (I have written lots of reviews, and I would write something negative if I could think of something..but I can't!) While in the area I highly reccommend seeing The Miracle of Christmas at the Sight and Sound Theater....FANTASTIC!! SIlver Dollar City at night was absolutely beautiful! Christmas lights galore!!!

Reviews.Title: “We will return to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: golfprosprincess
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, very clean, very accommodating. Loved the fact that it was off of the strip, yet easily accessible to anything in Branson. Check in was easy. Check out was easy. Very nice room. Great bathroom. Loved having a bigger shower instead of a shower/bath. Loved the sink area being larger. TV was nice, channel lineup good. Bed and pillows were very comfy. Wifi was easy to access. Desk area was nice. Overall great room. Definitely would recommend that they leave more than 2 full size towels for guests though and also would recommend that swimming towels be left in room. There is an indoor pool and it did look nice but we did not access it. The breakfast buffet was just ok. We ate it only once out of our 2 days there. We just didn't care much for it and the wait to make a waffle is too long. We will definitely stay here again on a return to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Clean and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: taterbabydoll
Reviews.Content: Loved the Hampton inn. Branson can be pretty noisy and crowded at times, but the Hampton is quiet and off the beaten path. The bathroom was spotless and the linens fresh. The room even smelled clean when you opened the door. The only negative I had was that we were the room closest to the elevator and vending area. That could get a little noisy at times. If you're wanting to play golf at Payne Stewart, this is THE place to stay. After finding this hotel, we won't be staying anywhere else when traveling to Branson!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: semoguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our 10 anniversary in Branson last weekend. I chose this place because we like most Hampton Inns and it wasn't on the strip (we like leisurely/quiet places). We were not disappointed. The motel was in a newer retail area just 1/2 mile north of the strip. The motel looked brand new and the rooms looked the same. Plenty of hot water for two of us and we heard no noises from the hallways. I think most of the clientel was older, but still very quiet. They had a nice breakfast with waffles, fruit, eggs, muffins, cereal, etc. The staff was helpful to our needs. I would go back and stay at this motel again. Plus, if you are playing Payne Steward Golf Club, this motel is about 300yds from the first tee. There was only one downside and i hesitate to list it, since it was out of the hotels control. On Friday night, our first night, there was a water main break somewhere on our side of town. Our motel was without water for 6 hours that evening. The staff was helpful and apologetic, but i was still charged full price. No big deal since we weren't really in our rooms much during that time frame.

Reviews.Title: “Checked in and right back out”
Reviews.Author: goinallover
Reviews.Content: We had reserved a king room, expecting the amenities we usually find in a Hampton king: fridge, couch, micro. We checked into this hotel (which is WAY off the strip), took one look at the room, and checked out and went to a different hotel. There was no couch, micro, fridge and when we went back down to the desk the clerk told us the hotel 'has 2 fridges' and we might could get one but she would have to wait till the housekeeper came on duty that afternoon to find out. We explained that since we planned to stay 3 days we needed a little more space and amenities then we left. The room was very nice but way too small.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Fravel
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was very pleasant. Due to our late arrival they offered us a larger room and late check out with no additional charge. The lady at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. Beds were comfortable and with lots of soft fluffy pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: txchargrandma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made this trip with very good friends. This was such a relaxing location and the city is lovely......and the countryside is BEAUTIFUL. VERY nice new airport that tries its best to be helpful. We plan to go back in a coupld of years. The shows were such fun!

Reviews.Title: “Someone must have interrupted the housekeeping staff...”
Reviews.Author: StPeters_MOTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business in August 2010. When I arrived, it was late at night and I had been in the car all day. I know that I didn't look my best but must have looked worse than I thought in sweats and a T-shirt because as I entered the hotel pulling my rollerbag, the hotel desk clerk was telling a story to her colleague. As I approached the front desk, she paused and looked at me, and then turned back to her co-worker to continue her tale as I stood and waited. After check-in, the room was fine and the temperature was fine, and the beds were basically what one gets in a hotel - not decadently comfortable, but not horrible either. The bedroom looked clean. However, the condition of the bathroom left me with the impression that someone had interrupted the housekeeping staff. There was no soap, and the sink was dirty and had clearly not been cleaned since the previous guest (hair in it, and what I hope was coffee stains.) Though I was only there for one night, I was very disappointed in the level of service and cleanliness and I'll try somewhere else next time I'm in town. As others have stated, the hotel is in a nice quiet location away from traffic but still very close to everything. If the bathrooms were clean, it would be a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Away from traffic, but close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: ARtraveler63
Reviews.Content: Had seen this property on a previous trip to Branson, and knew it would be a quiet place to stay. The rooms are very spacious with a sofa bed sitting area, and work station. Bathroom has a large vanity. TV, flat screen with great sound. Coffee maker in room. Bed was king size with a wonderful mattress. Breakfast was more than expected with scrambled eggs, omelets, and egg pizza's on various days. Fruit, yogurt, dry cereal, waffles, sweet rolls, bagels, and muffins always available. Coffee was great and they was a choice of juices. Hours from 6-10 was very convenient. There wasn't any bus traffic at this hotel during our visit and we enjoyed the "no line" access to the breakfast area. Did not use exercise room or swimming pool, but both appeared to be very adequate. Hotel is located in the Branson Hills area, and is away from traffic, etc., but there is a Chili's and Wendy's right down the road. With all the routes in Branson, we were able to get where we wanted to go within 5 -10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: momof2cs
Reviews.Content: we stayed ther friday april 16- sunday april 18. it was my husband and i and our 2 boys age 2 1/2 and 16 months. the hotel is very nice and clean. the rooms were nice however thee beds are very hard and pillows are flat as pancakes!!! the first night was the worst night sleep i have ever had. but the second night we got creative and doubled pillows and slept on top of the comforter to make do. there was a big group of young boys baseball teams staying there and it was EXTREMLY noisy!!! doors slamming running in the halls and loud talking. but taht probably worked out for us because of our young ones. it did not bother me a bit if they were too loud or jumping in our room. we could hear everything the person in the room next too us was saying including there alarm going off at 5am! but on a better note it was nice to be away from the strip and all the traffic and it was very easy to get around! the breakfast was pretty good and they had a variety and plenty of everything! would i stay here again? probably i would just have to bring my own pillow!!

Reviews.Title: “A great new facility....all new and shiny. Front desk folks especially helpful.”
Reviews.Author: georgiagull
Reviews.Content: Let's face it...Branson is not an easy place to get around. We had a hard time finding the VC. Things were NOT well marked. I guess they assume one knows where everything is? BUT...these folks were great. Debby gave us her card..and said call me if you need help. I wish we had asked them about what shows to see. Also, we got a better rate dealing directly with the property!! I believe they had a pool and fitness center...we were just too busy to use them.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it! Just a smidge drive from the strip...Close to shopping.”
Reviews.Author: twiggizbiz
Reviews.Content: Thanksgiving weekend...breakfast was varied and always fresh. Bed was lush and comfy! LOVED the comforter. Shower was awesome! Loved the vanity table. The cable TV was spotty, but we weren't there to watch TV so it was tolerable. The walls were a little thinner than we'd expect, but we still preferred the stay. Even though it wasn't in the "heart" of the city - that was fine by us. Kept you out of the chaos of traffic and was easy to get to from either direction. Very easy on/off freeway as well as offered back roads to the attractions. Hampton has started off nicely with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, new hotel”
Reviews.Author: pelaminnesota
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it was brand new, and the price was right. It was very comfortable and quiet. Furnishings are modern, nice views of the surrounding hills. It was a bit far from the center of Branson, but worth the drive.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel in Branson”
Reviews.Author: OmahaHusker
Reviews.Content: This is a very new (opened in Spring 2009) hotel and as you would expect, everything is very modern, clean, and well-appointed. We had a king room with a sofa, it was very roomy and comfortable. The hot free breakfast was good - biscuits, sausage patties, eggs were the offering along with fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, juice, and coffee. The eating area was decent sized but was pretty full at 9:30 on Saturday. The hotel is a bit hard to find, it's not real well-marked which might be due to it's newness, in fact the entire area is a new development surrounding the Payne Stewart golf course which also is brand new (opened in June 2009). As time goes by I would expect the grounds to look a bit better as the landscaping has time to grow, but it certainly wasn't dirty or difficult to get around. Access to downtown Branson and the Branson Landing is easy via Hwy 65, and access to the rest of Branson isn't bad either via the Red Route that runs parallel to Hwy 76. We found upon check-in that we were sharing a floor with a lot of youth girls softball players attending a nearby tournament, and we were concerned that we'd hear lots of noise. However, the noise was non-existent - we didn't have any issues with hearing doors slam or voices in the hallways. In all, this was a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, New, Clean Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hotelsnob90
Reviews.Content: Myself, husband, and two boys (ages 9 & 11) stayed at this hotel for three nights along with my parents, and my brother & sister-in-law. We loved the location. It's north of the main strip and away from the congestion yet close to all the things we wanted to see. Just grap a map from the hotel desk when you arrive or mapquest to the places you know you're going to want to go. Quick and easy to get to Silver Dollar City & Branson Landing, too. The hotel was very clean, and the man at the front desk was very helpful. He even printed off a list of movie times for us when we asked about a local movie theater. The beds are comfortable and the breakfast was great. The breakfast items were kept well stocked ,and there was a good variety of things to choose from. The workout room was large and had a good variey of machines, as well as weights and a balancing ball. Towels and free ice cold water was also available in the workout room. The kids enjoyed the indoor pool. The only thing I was disappointed in was our daily housekeeping. I made our beds everyday and put our dirty towels in the tub, as did my sister-in-law did in their room . Neither one of us had all of our garbage dumped everyday. One day our towels were not replaced, they took the dirty one but didn't leave any clean towels. It was no big deal and they gladly gave us towels at the desk, but we were just suprised by this. My parents did not experience any of these problems, but they also did not make their own bed. So, if you great housekeeping service there, maybe you shouldn't make the bed for them? All things considered, I highly recommend this hotel. My sister-in-law and I are very fussy when it comes to hotels, and overall we were truly satisfied with our stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn Branson - Branson Hills
HotelInfo.Address: 200 South Payne Stewart Drive, Branson, MO 65616
